cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 310 mi east of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to slow, turn west then northwest, and track toward the upper-Texas coast while paralleling or hugging the shoreline early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-upper Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O'Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX for hurricane conditions; Port Mansfield, TX to High Island, TX (including Galveston Bay) for storm surge
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from Port Mansfield, TX eastward to southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–58 mph) likely; a 22% chance of 50-kt (≥58 mph) winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: In Galveston Bay, including Texas City, water rises of 2–4 ft above ground are possible if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain with potential totals well over 4 inches; flooding possible Sunday through mid-week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal flooding during high tide cycles
